instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP M1
threads.message:
Hi’ 
I have a MacBook Pro 2020 with M1 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a strange issue.
i get Apple boot but go directly to the “prohibitory symbol”.
I Can not get access to anything through “push and hold power button” nor command R… 
The Mac does not accept DFU so it might be a hardware issue (T2).
The board is clean but had a short/blown RL610 5v line. 
anybody seen that prohibitory issue on M1 before ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBP M1
threads.message:
Don't need to press power button on T2 machines, for shortcut key combinations.
Once machine is off, press R (or Command + R) for recovery mode.
If not possible, then could be a T2 issue.
If also no way to put in DFU with keyboard, then use SV004/5 to force it.
